website_summaries.verdict: Many say these work wonders with your foot problems, but no pain, no gain. The sandals may be uncomfortable at first, so follow the manufacturer's instructions.
pros: Amazing arch support for a flip-flop
Great for people with plantar fasciitis, pronation concerns, heel spurs, and other foot problems
Received the APMA Seal of Acceptance
Comes in a variety of colors
Woven polyurethane upper with leather trim
Soft woven toe post and foam-lined strap
cons: Manufacturer recommends ordering the nearest size down if you are a half size

customer_reviews.title: Defect???
customer_reviews.text: I've had half a dozen orthaheel/vionic flip flops my mom has over 30 pair. I've always been happy until this last pair. The flip flops have come apart at the footbed and sole. It appears the footbed has shrunk and is curling. Very unhappy with this pair
customer_reviews.author: Lynn L

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find some flip flops I with built in arch support and I was hoping these would be just what I was looking for. While they are very sturdy, well made and the arch supports are very high, I have given them numerous chances and I just don't care for them. They actually make my feet hurt worse and force me to walk on the outsides of my feet which has caused hip pain. They just didn't work for me and I don't see a return option.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Conoyer

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T LAST A YEAR AND I HARDLY WEAR THEM!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing as I have work Vionic's for years and been very happy with their quality (PURCHASED FROM MY PODIATRIST, NOT AMAZON) I've worn these minimally the past 10 months, and tonight the bottom portion on the right flop came completely UNGLUED. I'll post a pic shortly, once I go fish them out of the trash. So disappointing to spend so much and receive likely FAKE product. I have other VIONICs that are 5, 6 years old and still GOING strong. Buy yours from a reputable seller. I think I only saved $7-10 buying on AMAZON. NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.author: MsShep

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as they used to be. The thong becomes loose after only a few times wearing it. The shoe then does not stay in the proper position on my foot. My foot flops around. The reason I buy Orthoheel is to keep my foot in line. Also the foot bed compresses quickly and does not give good support anymore. I have wore this sandal for years. Now due to poor quality I must find a new brand for foot support.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!  I wear them year round...even in winter as house shoes instead of slippers. Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these flip flops. Great feeling on my feet and definitely the best I have worn in the flip flop category. I wear them in the winter, too, (as house shoes instead of slippers) since those never have any arch support. Yes, they are a bit pricey but I gladly pay it since I have yet to find anything even close to the support and comfort I have found with these shoes. I have tried many other types and brands but really can’t say anything comes close to my favorite vionic tidal II
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and the comfort of how it gives relief to the arch. I suffer from planters fasciitis. Of course with any shoes you should take into consideration. You should have inside shoes and outside shoes . You should not expect these flip-flops to last three years without the strap Breakin . when you have a foot problem don’t try and prolong your shoes. Always keep them fresh. I see all these complaints and I have three pairs that I use and never once had my shoes fall apart. I’m just speaking with my experience. I think the three different ones I have gotten so far are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but had a blowout already.
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this shoe. It has helped alleviate my flat foot, no arch pain I have daily. It took no time to get used to these and now I have a pair of nice flip flops to wear around the house. I gave the shoes only 2 stars because within one month of purchase, the sole separated and I had to superglue it back together. I am not an overly fat girl. I could stand to lose some pizza and chocolate cookies from my diet, however, a shoe blowout in less than a month is unacceptable. I would love another pair, but it is highly unlikely because I cant afford a new pair of $70 shoes every month.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits & supports well enough but fell apart in 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: They are a little wider than expected which means that because of the arch, they slip to the side. Not a huge deal because I really needed the arch support and this is what my doctor suggested. However, they came unglued and I bought them just a week over 3 months ago. If I wore them every day, that would still irritate me but I don't. And being in the pandemic, I don't even leave my house that much so they are mostly worn inside anyway. For this much money, I expected them to last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sandals!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a fallen arch on my right foot and I needed some shoes that would be comfortable for my cruise that's coming up in September. These flip flops are stylish, super comfortable and just what I needed! I wore them around the house for the day and I'll admit they were a little uncomfortable at first, but I think that was my body adjusting to them. After 5 mins or so, I realized my knees, hips and legs were not hurting like they always do. I highly recommend any Vionic shoes if you suffer from fallen arches or planter fasciitis!
customer_reviews.author: JSJ Construction, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these three years ago... they are the only flip flops I have worn since and they have lasted all three years! Finally this summer they feel worn out and stretched, it’s finally time for a new pair. I feel like three years is a very respectable length of time for a well worn shoe to last. These look decent and really helped ease my plantar fasciitis pain and provide the arch support that I need as I have very high arches. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: dlith

customer_reviews.title: Great comfy support sandal. Return customer
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair. The first pair is 2 years old, and has held up very well. I wear a US9 in regular shoes, but the size 8 in Vionics fits perfectly. Really gives good arch support and is comfortable. Strap and thong area are nicely made, not causing any discomfort even after hours of walking at the zoo.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyFeather

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I did order 1/2 size up per the reviews I read. I'm normally an 8.5 so got a 9. I love these! They are perfect for the arches and definitely support my feet. I feel like when I'm not wearing my actual orthotics, and when wearing these, they feel almost identical! I feel these will help (hopefully) prevent further plantar fasciitis as I go into my 2nd and 3rd trimester of pregnancy. I also bought these in white since I love them so much!
customer_reviews.author: Clowe

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite "Shoes"
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago, I developed a heel spur and my doctor recommended inserts with a heel cup and arch support. The inserts were the same shape as these. During the summer months I don't want to wear shoes, especially around the house. These flip flops offer the support I need with the comfort I want. I bought my first pair over a decade ago. I just bought my third pair. I hope they are still making them when this pair wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Savelli

customer_reviews.title: Best Support Sandal Ever
customer_reviews.text: Such a great sandal. This makes the fifth Vionic product I’ve purchased. I love them, but I won’t be tricked by Facebook ads that claim to be Vionic. I bought a pair for $19.99 and they were from China. I tried them on and threw them in the charity bag. They were not real Vionic sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I was really hopeful that these sandals would help my plantar fasciitis but sadly they did not. I tried them out for a while hoping it was just a matter of my feet getting used to them. Unfortunately, I think they hurt my feet more than helped. I would normally never pay $70 for flip flops but I did so in desperation. I wound up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Lady G

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe in Black, Navy & Black Tortoise. I generally wear a size 8.5 medium width and sized up to size 9. I did try the size 8 but it was a little short & the straps were a little too tight so I do recommend you size up to the next whole size. If you like flip flops but need more support, these are the answer!
customer_reviews.author: Ann H

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just not for me!
customer_reviews.text: Not my taste, but very well made. They were a bit bulky and felt heavy on my feet. Although they would have been great on an orthopedic level, I just couldn't get over how "big" they looked in the mirror. I wear a 7.5 and ordered an 8, and I felt as if they ran too large. If I were to order again, I'd order down a size. Keep in mind though, my Mom on the other hand, LOVES and boasts about these sandals to everyone... I think she has around 5 pairs. Just goes to say that not every shoe is a good fit for everyone. Great product, just not for me!
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome sandals. Very comfortable. Made for people with medium high arches. I can't wear them everyday or my feet get sore but that's only because I have extremely high arches. I will say, these are the only sandals I can wear so I bought 2 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Maddux

customer_reviews.title: The color was correct so this accounts for the one ...
customer_reviews.text: The color was correct so this accounts for the one star rating. The sandal I received is defection by means that the straps are too tight and the arch is in the wrong place leading to foot pain. I own 15 pairs of this exact sandal/size, one of which I bought from another seller on amazon just last week and they all fit perfectly and cause no pain. I am currently working with seller to have item returned via pickup from my shipping address so I will not be further inconvenienced than I already am.
customer_reviews.author: Sagebelle

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes came highly recommended to me by an orthopedic and friend. I’m really glad I gave them a shot. They correct the position of my foot and are so comfortable. I will warn you though they take a little while to get used to. I would suggest only wearing them for two hours max each day the first week. Especially if you have a low arches. I wore them one full day, about 10 hours the first time and my arches ached pretty bad the next day.
customer_reviews.author: EKeane

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE SHOES!! Yeah, I love all my Vionic sandals, but these ones have a slightly different fit. Little tighter & cradle foot more- if that makes any sense. Had a post tibial tendon issue & after 10 mos I can walk barefoot again!! My other treatment helped, but I know is is also because of wearing nothing but these sandals for the past 2 mos. from the minute got out of bed to the minute I got back in at night. I now have 6 pair & looking into Vionic sneakers to wear for winter...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: coming apart
customer_reviews.text: On the top part of the strap, the black shiny color is already peeling off of the straps, leaving a white color behind. Looks horrible. Can't believe I spent this much money and they are coming apart. Highly disappointed in this product. I also bought Vionic walking shoes (another great cost) and they are peeling apart too. I will NEVER buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lipps

customer_reviews.title: Heeled spurs & fasciitis!
customer_reviews.text: Love these flips! I had planters fasciitis & bone spurs on my heel. Saw foot dr for 6 months. Did everything they said except surgery. These shoes fixed my foot! I couldn't believe it after being told I could never wear flips again! I will admit they cause me mild ankle pain if I wear them for long days on my feet but in general I love them.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Horribly uncomfortable! I knew the arches would take getting used to but the base is so wide that my foot slides off the arch onto the edge of the sandle instead of being cradled within. Not much cushion for the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been suffering from plantar fasciitis for about a year, and this is the only footwear that have completely relieved me of the heel pain. My heel hurt every single day whether I rest it or not; walking intensifies the pain (as expected). This is the first time I've been pain-free since it I've had plantar fasciitis. I wore orthotics, and night splint every day. Those helped with the pain to some degree, but they didn't completely relieve me of my heel pain. I wish I had bought these sooner. I can walk all day in these, and not feel any pain. Excellent support, very comfortable, and stylish enough for to match any outfit. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ahhhb

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for just under three months and the straps that go over my feet are very stretched out, making them useless to wear from a comfort or support perspective. And of course it’s too late to return them. They are an expensive disappointment. They were pretty good before they got stretched out.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Keyerleber

customer_reviews.title: Straps cause blisters
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these. I thought I was going to love them. They definitely seemed comfortable when I first put them on. Then I went for a walk of less than a mile to the grocery store and back. On the way home I had to walk barefoot because both feet has massive blisters with the skin ripped off under the straps. These are going back and my feet are in pain.
customer_reviews.author: Saucey Chic

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite shoes, easily
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes, easily. I get pain on the ball of my foot from low arches with any tennis shoes I've worn but I could wear these all day. My only complaint is there's a square sewn right where the prong goes between your toes that gave me a blister the first few times I wore them. My foot got used to it (and I'm sure the shoes was worn in a bit too) and it's not an issue unless I literally wear them all day. I would buy all vionic orthaheel shoes if they made them! I just wish they weren't so expensive. That being said, I wore these all last summer and they still look new.
customer_reviews.author: ktlvskt

customer_reviews.title: Love these sandals!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very hesitant to buy these sandals. My doctor recommend me to buy these pair because they would help relieve my foot pain. It has helped drastically !!! Highly recommend! Worth every penny !
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: My feet were aching from my plantar fasciitis and I ...
customer_reviews.text: My feet were aching from my plantar fasciitis and I was unable to walk without limping. I have faithfully worn these sandals, inside and out, for the last two weeks and my pain has greatly decreased. I am currently living in Florida, so wearing sandals is expected. I plan to order other Vionic footwear to meet my other fashion needs.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: These babies are so comfortable I wear them over all my other shoes combined
customer_reviews.text: If I could give more stars I would!! When the podiatrist said no more flip flops I could have cried! These babies are so comfortable I wear them over all my other shoes combined. Once they're on they don't look like an orthotic shoe; but man do they feel like it! So much support for plantar fasciitis sufferers it's almost unbelievable! Buy them! You'll thank yourself!
customer_reviews.author: AAKRN

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this product if you are already suffering with your ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from reading the reviews online. They are bigger and wider on sizing. I had more issues with my plantar fasciitis because the arch is so rigid and high, it altered my weight shifting and walking and I ended up having pains on the side of both legs where my weight is distributed. I wouldn't recommend this product if you are already suffering with your feet. They may seem to work at first few use but you end up developing long- term side effects and make your heel or feet pain worse.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Snaps

customer_reviews.title: The only shoes I want to wear
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these shoes. I will order them again. They’re comfortable, fit perfectly, give my feet good support, and can be washed easily. They’re the only shoes I want to wear.
customer_reviews.author: DFC

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality & Comfort
customer_reviews.text: May actually like better than my Olukai Flip Flops. Wear almost every day. Would buy additional pairs if I didn’t have so many new Olukai ones. Better arch support on these. Arch support great. Can wear all day, even with old broken bone foot injury.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Harley

customer_reviews.title: Ok if i dont wear all day walking.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these to work for a while and they were fine, but then i wore them to an amusement park and instead of one foot hurting like normal, both fee hurt so bad at the end of the day. Guess you cannot wear these if you plan on doing alot of walking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric/Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My favorite flip flops!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable! These are the only sandals that I can wear all day without stirring up plantar faciatus. This style is pretty basic. Ilike that the foot bed matches the rest of the shoe as compared to my old pair that has a brown food bed and black upper. I concur with another buyer that the arch feels a little higher than on my old pair. Perhaps my old pair has compacted a bit from so much wear? If you have foot problems, these are definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: CabushkaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Workmanship going downhill?
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Vionic/Orthaheel for 6 years. The arch support of this sandal combined with deep heel cup and cushy bed provided welcome relief from painful plantar fasciitis. this is my 3rd or 4th pair of this exact thong sandal, and for the first time i am disappointed. The bed is stiff and hard, feels like cheap plastic, and the fit is loose. Workmanship has gone downhill and these are going back.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G.

customer_reviews.title: Vionic Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 8.5 in sandals so first time around I ordered a 9. too big. Amazon was fabulous as always on the return. As soon as credit was posted I reordered an 8. Perfect fit this time. Love the arch support. My lower legs / fronts on chins usually ache pretty bad by the end of the day. have for years. Well now they don't. Its amazing. All I can say is if you have problems with low back, leg and foot pain, try these. It might take you a couple days to get used to walking on them, but after that, they are so comfy, you will never by a regular pair of flip flops again.
customer_reviews.author: D.Walling / Ariz.

customer_reviews.title: So far o good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My left was a little smaller but I think my foot was a swollen from the weekend. I could use the arch to be higher but that’s not a doctors opinion. For the most part, I can walk in the morning when I get up. I bought 3 pairs, different colors and wore 2 so far. I love them. Over 50 and I don’t recommend cheap, flat flip flops.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Prestley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my foot issues!
customer_reviews.text: I have Plantar Fasciitis, bone spurs in both feet, and pronation in my ankles and I've struggled trying to find shoes that offer the support I need. It's a flip flop and they are awesome arch and heel support. I can wear them all day without pain. The only issue I have with them is that they will squeak. It's just the material of the footbed. I don't like that, but there's nothing I can do about it. Pain free is the main thing and this shoe is as close as I've been in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: BFields

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these (different color) because they are SO GOOD. Vionic is the first shoe I can actually feel the arch support (I have high arches). As someone who suffers from plantars fasciitis, wearing these shoes regularly have greatly reduced my pain. You can't put a price on that. I tell everyone I know how great these shoes are! This is one shoe that is DEFINITELY worth the price! And I don't usually like to pay a lot for things. I'm a loyal Vionic customer now because nothing else compares.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: these are VERY hard and they put a great deal of pressure on your arch
customer_reviews.text: Ok, these are VERY hard and they put a great deal of pressure on your arch. I am having to get used to them as my feet have been killing me. I know that what they are designed to do will only make my feet better. Unfortunately, I can only wear them around the house and not to work. I might look into seeing what they have in a work shoe.
customer_reviews.author: DeeJFL

customer_reviews.title: Absolute life savers
customer_reviews.text: I live in flip flops at least 70% of the year and I have never found a pair that gives me the arch and heel support that I need. Having issues with plantar fascitis, my pediatrist recommended these Vionic (and actually sells them in his office). They are so comfortable and I can walk and stand in them for hours with no pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hughes

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful! I recently broke my ankle and had surgery ...
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! I recently broke my ankle and had surgery so when I could go back to wearing shoes I was limited to sneakers. Then I saw Vionics at my Physical Therapy place so decided to look into them. Since it was summer I wanted a sandal I could wear around home. These are the only sandals I wore all summer. I recently decided to try the Vionic sneakers but accidentally purchased the wrong size but will return and repurchase as well as look into the inserts too. I am sold on Vionic!!
customer_reviews.author: Janis Demond

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 8 and I've tried these in size 8 in a store and they fit perfect, but I hesitated in purchasing because comfort isn't stylish. I finally gave in and decided I was going to get a comfy pair of flip flops and since I had tried these in a size 8, I ordered the size 8. Unfortunately they did not fit at all...I'll have to continue my search for stylish comfy flip flops:(
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and support!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I deal with planters fasciitis and also love to wear sandals, but by the end of the day my feet ache. With these shoes having the right support, they are comfortable all day. Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlie

customer_reviews.title: Try Vionic sandals, they are great, helps arch support and comes in lots of colors and true to your size.
customer_reviews.text: Love these sandals as better support than just regular flip-flops. The fit is true to my size of 8m and whatever anyone else wears should be what they usually wear. Takes maybe a day or two to get used to for some, but I wore all day and did shopping etc. and all fine. Depends what you are used to. The price is worth the quality and I might even get another color but for now as they say, black goes with everything. Very glad I got these, and think it was some commercial on TV that intrigued me to try. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support
customer_reviews.text: I only buy Vionic now. Good arch support. Can't do cheap flip flops anymore. They are well made, but, being in Florida, they get worn every day, so replace them regularly.
customer_reviews.author: shay

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I feel about this I paid $70 thinking these would be amazing and I don’t feel that way. They are cute but other then that not sure they were worth that kind of money. Wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Hollynoel345

customer_reviews.title: Love these flip flops!
customer_reviews.text: These flip flops are awesome. I bought the exact same style and color several years ago and they are so comfortable and give great support. They are also true to size. The only reason I had to replace them is I got them caught on something and the toe post came out. My fault entirely! They are very durable; I just wore them non-stop all year long for several years, even in the woods walking my dogs, and I was very hard on them. I got my first pair at a Vionics store and the price at Amazon is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Never without them.
customer_reviews.text: I only wear orthoheel shoes, for years I suffered looking for the right shoe, and ultimately ending up at the end of the day aching, painful feet and legs. until I saw Dr.Weil on an infomercial, ( I do alternative meds. as well) and wala! I bought my first pair, and have only worn that brand since, with the occasional exception of an athletic shoe I was dying to have then I place "walk fit" insoles in them.
customer_reviews.author: Ladonna

customer_reviews.title: Painful (at first)
customer_reviews.text: I'm really trying to give these a shot, but my feet are actually hurting the worst they have in a while. For $60+, they should not make my problem worse. UPDATE: Once my feet adjusted to the shoes, my feet feel better than they have in a long time. I'm actually planning to purchase another pair in a different color as soon as I have the spare money. They are kind of expensive, but worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MONIE

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in grey for my mother who has thick, wide, flat feet. She was having heel pains so I thought these would help and she confirmed that her feet do feel better. She said they are very comfortable and if mom likes them, I like them. There is good arch support and the flip flops are not too stiff. Mom likes that the thong between the toes is made of fabric and doesn't hurt when walking. She's been wearing them every day this summer.
customer_reviews.author: BigBlueFish

customer_reviews.title: Just Got Them
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them for a few hours for a few days so far. Fit is good. I find that my legs and arches are a bit sore after wearing them. They also have a larger appearance to them, which makes them a bit clunky looking. While I understand that the purpose of this sandal is support, it would be great if they could somehow make them a little sleeker looking without compromising comfort. I think the price is a little high, but would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Scott

customer_reviews.title: These are a necessity if you have plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I need to help my plantar fasciitis. I cannot stand to go barefoot and these shoes give me good support and I wear them in the house and outside too in warm weather. I have three pair with different colors
customer_reviews.author: Loretta L. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Short distance shoes
customer_reviews.text: Wore these on vacation for the first time. Loved the way my feet and legs felt, but didn't expect to have terrible blisters on the bottom of my feet after only one day. The straps across the front cut into my skin and I had to buy band aids for the top and bottoms of my feet in order to wear them. Eventually, I gave up and borrowed my daughter's shoes toward the end of our trip. I will definitely wear them again - just not for long distances.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Incredible, Supportive sandal!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite sandals ever! Wow. To be wearing sandals with arch support and heel stability. Sandals are always flat and hurt my feet. I can wear these all day. BUT - it does take a bit to get used to them. Because they change the posture of your feet - break them in - don't wear all day at first. Will make you feet and legs ache for a few days as they readjust the alignment. Will get pairs in every color and looking at other Vionic shoes also!
customer_reviews.author: Nana277

customer_reviews.title: Too loose for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes definitely have the support I'm looking for, however are too loose on my narrow feet. I'm super disappointed to throw away $65 on shoes that are so loose. Can't return to amazon once you try them out. I should have stuck with ordering from zappos. The fit lengthwise was good. I typically wear 8.5 and the 8s are perfect. I wish they sold these in narrow!
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money so far!
customer_reviews.text: The fit and style is great. I usually buy cheap flip flops, but by the end of the day my feet hurt so bad I can barely walk. These were wonderful. It was like wearing sneakers with my orthotic inserts all day. I have only had them a week, so I don't know how they will hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Nice & supportive
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist recommended these shoes, because I have plantar fasciitis. They're very comfortable and supportive. I can walk around with them comfortably. They're expensive, but I still highly recommend these sandals for those suffering with plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherKay

customer_reviews.title: Great for plantar fascitis
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with heel pain for months now and totally unable to wear anything that doesn't have a high heel which keeps my arch stretched, or something with an insert....both of which were going to be an issue for summer flip flops. These are wonderful. While they are very firm on the bottom, they have a heel cup and built in arch support...exactly what the foot needs to stay properly aligned. My only issue is the price....I want more but at $65 a pair, they are pricey!
customer_reviews.author: Navigo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, relatively comfortable but not cute
customer_reviews.text: This slipper is basically just as it states: Orthopedic! I personally wished it was a little cuter and fashionable for a lady. It does take some breaking in to becoming comfortable. I suspect that I would eventually appreciate it as it does look like it is quite durable. I would recommend it to a person who simply needs an Orthopedic slipper with no specific desire for fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Dahlia Ann Howard -Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Toe problem
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return the sandals. I normally wear a 7.5 so I ordered an 8. They were a bit too large, but the main problem I had was the toe thong cut into my toe. I just couldn't tolerate my toe being pinched. The arch support and comfort on the rest of the sandal was fantastic. I plan to order another style in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals
customer_reviews.text: I have back issues, so I always wear these sandals for long walks and standing. I wish they were a little bit more attractive, but they are wonderful to wear and have great support/arch.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My podiatrist suggested theses and I love them. My heel and arch feel so good ...
customer_reviews.text: I have recently begun to wear only Vionic shoes.My podiatrist suggested theses and I love them. My heel and arch feel so good that I can no longer wear other brands of shoes. I have several co-workers who now only wear them also.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: These are flip flops but have great arch support! What a difference! Very comfortable and fit as expected - I wear an 8 1/2 usually so got these in an 8 and they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ann R

customer_reviews.title: Love the comfort the arch gives me
customer_reviews.text: Love the comfort the arch gives me. My only complaint is that after several hours of wear the top of my left foot where the strap comes up between my toes started having a very sharp pain. Will try them again to see if it continues.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Jo

customer_reviews.title: These were to replace a former pair that wore out.
customer_reviews.text: They're a little fancier, but every bit as good as my old ones!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Great for anyone with plantar fasciitis but who says I’ll wants to wear flip flops. So comfortable and I had no adjustment period to them. The only flip flop I wear during the summer?
customer_reviews.author: Darlene E. Prior

customer_reviews.title: Cute & Supportive
customer_reviews.text: These hurt my arches for the first few days so I only wore them sporadically but now they feel great and my feet don't get tired and achy even if I'm walking or standing long periods of time. I had Spenco flip flops and was looking for a cuter-looking pair, and these fit the bill perfectly in terms of looking good but still providing support to prevent my plantar fasciitis from flaring up.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M Frohmader

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and a pleasure to walk in
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for 4 hours today and had no pain in my hips or sacrum. They are very comfortable and a pleasure to walk in. I am an 8 or 8 1/2 shoe size. These size 8 sandals feel better than my shoes with orthotics in them. There is great arch support. I will probably order another pair shortly.
customer_reviews.author: beachlover

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled, yet
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews and ordered a half size down since I typically wear an 8.5. These are not a great fit. Tight through the top. I wear the Vionic booties with no problem and am on my feet all day. These are painful for my arches. I'm trying to break them in as I do like this brand, but for now - ouch!
customer_reviews.author: Arr6810

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after one month! I have bought these sandals several times since my feet like a higher arch and need support. This time, the part between the toes lifted up and started coming out after just one month of regular wear. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: LifeisGood_SD

customer_reviews.title: These flops are great for my arch support and tired feet
customer_reviews.text: These flops are great for my arch support and tired feet! They are a little weird to get use to, because I've grown up in flip flops with no kind of arch support, but my feet have been giving me a lot of trouble lately and these really help. Even just putting them on around the house when I get home helps them feel better at the end of the day, but I've also worn them all day with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful flip flops. Approved by my orthopedic. Had now for almost a year, wear them all the time. Took a few days not to hurt my flat feet, but after that no pain! They even dry fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad experience
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 pairs and it has been a very bad experience in less than 1 month they have broken, they all opened the bottom. We live in Peru as missionaries and we cannot return them because of the distance. before they lasted longer. And the purchases because my wife have always been comfortable, but the last purchases very bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected.
customer_reviews.text: It's VERY stiff and I am not used to the arch being so stiff. They have not received enough wear to form to feet as the winter months are here and they were purchased late fall. So, may update. They are kinda pricy and there are other options if after the break in period, they still are too rigid.
customer_reviews.author: bbTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking sandal, great footbed.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit. I have had Vionic shoes before so my feet are used to the sole. The straps are taking a little getting used to. Nice looking and dressier than the usual flip flop, but it would be great to see an even dressier version. Slightly narrow at the widest part of my foot, so not the most flattering but better than the others I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: O. Howard

customer_reviews.title: I live in these!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I live in them. I have problems with Plantar fasciities. These shoes make it possible for me to walk in the warm heat and fee like I need orthapedic shoes! I wear them all day around the house. They are a bit smaller and I do believe the arch may take a getting use to at the beginning but in time at all they are a perfect shoe. I have now bought them in other colors too! LOVE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jrin

customer_reviews.title: Great flop-flops for those with plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: These flip flops are very comfortable (give them a day or two to break them in) and have good arch support. These are the only flip flops that I can wear now, because they do not aggravate my plantar fasciitis. I would have given fdive stars, if not for the high price-tag. However, this is the second color that I bought, because they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: annmarie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these but suddenly SMALLER?!?
customer_reviews.text: My wife discovered Vionic/Orthaheel 3 years ago after suffering from painful plantar fasciitis and only wears these brands in many styles (sandals, boots, heels). They have always been true to size...until today. She just received a pair of the exact same size she's been wearing and they are too small (width and length). Have to return them, hope the next size up isn't too big. Minus 1 star for changing the sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M.

customer_reviews.title: The most supportive flip flops!
customer_reviews.text: I AM IN LOVE! I have plantar fasciitis and it was killing me to not be able to comfortably wear flip flops. These are so comfortable! They don't look bulky or weird, they just look like flip flops, yet they have so much support! I want to buy these in other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable with great support
customer_reviews.text: I just discovered this brand I have two pair and in the process of ordering more. Very comfortable with great support. I have worn regular flip flops and sandals for years my feet are now needing the orthotic support as a result of flat no support summer footwear. I am a shoeaholic and this brand offers stylish sandals/flip flops that don’t look like an orthopedic correction shoe. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: valerie kast

customer_reviews.title: Wife has worn these for years
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these and when they wear out replaces them with the same sandal because of the comfort, fit and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph L.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love Vionic shoes! I have back problems and planters fasciitis and these sandals feel so good!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Ford

customer_reviews.title: I really love this flip flop
customer_reviews.text: I really love this flip flop! Wonderful support and comfortable to wear all day. They look good with just about everything I wear. Only negative is the straps are a little big. Granted my foot is a little narrow. I'm going to take them to the shoe repair place and see if they can take the straps up. Arrived on time and happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joduette

customer_reviews.title: Order a size down
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to buy these shoes, I recommend ordering a size down as your normal size would be too big. I ordered an 8 but should have bought a 7. I must have missed the size recommendation in the description. It is a great shoe though giving your feet the right support and comfort so I'll buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this shoe previously but my sister's puppy ate them - so this is my second pair. I have low arches and these flip flops are perfect 'house shoes' as well as great walking shoes. I am a true 7.5 and the size 8 is a perfect fit in this flip flop.They provide a wide base of support as well as great arch support! They are worth the price (and less expensive on Amazon; thanks Amazon!)
customer_reviews.author: Tejanamama

customer_reviews.title: They are a little painful at first just because I have flat feet and ...
customer_reviews.text: The podiatrist told me to get these shoes because I was having foot pain. After about a week the pain was gone. They are a little painful at first just because I have flat feet and had not worn anything with arch support. Once I got use to them I wear them all day long. If I don't wear them and go barefoot I notice a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Do you want more foot, leg, knee, and back pain?  Buy these sandals.
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible sandals. If I could give them zero stars, I would. A friend recommended them so I bought them, big mistake. My back, knees, legs, and feet HURT whenever I wear these sandals. Now I have blisters on my second toes of both feet from these sandals. Unfortunately, these sandals can't be returned and are going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Cut into the skin between my first and second toe
customer_reviews.text: The plastic piece of the slipper holding it onto the foot cut into the skin between my first and second toe. My knees and feet hurt wearing the slippers. I only wore them as house slippers for two days before they cut my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Filoola

customer_reviews.title: Size is pretty true!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have arch support, which I need. The first couple times they were a bit stiff but after wearing them several times over the last week, they are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Run Big
customer_reviews.text: The flip flop are very well made. The bed of the shoe is very firm and can make the bottom of your feet sore if you wear them to long, but they do help with my plantar fasciitis by supporting my foot and keeping it from turning inward. The secret is not to wear them for long periods of time until you get use to them. I ordered a size 8, but I normally wear a size 71/2. They are a little larger than I wanted, but wearable. Maybe next time i"ll order a size 7.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda K. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Good for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: At my doctor’s suggestion, I bought these sandals for inside use to help treat my plantar fasciitis. Initially the fit seemed stranger, but I followed the directions and wore the sandals for only a few hours every day at the beginning. Within a couple of days my feet adjusted to the feel. It has helped relieve some of the pain and I intend to buy a second pair for outside use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I think I have planter fasciatis and hope the shoes will correct the problem.
customer_reviews.text: Feels good to my foot except in between my toes it hurts. Too early to tell if it’s helping my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sandal
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of orthaheel shoes. It does take some getting used to. It's a good idea to wear them around the house to try to get used to the fit. I did experience with my first pair, which are exactly like these but in a different color,that the straps stretched a little. Not a big deal for me though. If your feet over-pronate, you may want to give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Haddock

customer_reviews.title: A Place to start
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 8 and they fit fine. When I walk, the foot bed feels longer than the forefoot, so it seems to slap a little bit when I walk. They are comfortable and doesn't exacerbate my plantar fasciitis. That is a plus. I have ordered another brand to compare since I used to live in flip flops. I need multiple pairs that are comfortable and pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Hiking Honu

customer_reviews.title: High Quality shoe. Needs a bit more cushioning to the sole
customer_reviews.text: A bit too stiff. Needs a bit more cushioning. Otherwise a high quality shoe
customer_reviews.author: VeryOpinionated

customer_reviews.title: These are the best flip flops I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: These are the best flip flops I've ever worn. The support on them can't be beat. I do recommend, however, buying a size down. The straps will loosen on the top with wear and the shoe will become a little big. I got a size down and after I got them broken in they fit like an absolute glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: The problem I have is the strap is not snug ...
customer_reviews.text: The problem I have is the strap is not snug which makes me tighten my toes to keep them on. I may return them because of it. I normally wear a 71/2 but they don't make half sizes so I got an 8. If the strap on the shoe was tighter I would give a five. They do help with Plantar Fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Carnahan

product_meta.title: Vionic Women's Tide II Toe Post Sandal
product_meta.description: Women's Vionic, Tide II Sandal. Proven to effectively alleviate heel pain, these sandals are stylish and good for your feet. The built-in orthotic helps with heel pain and helps to properly align your body. Dual layer leather or suede uppers in a thong style Proven to effectively alleviate heel pain.* Thong sandal style for an easy on and off Manmade and fabric lining Podiatrist designed, biomechanical orthotic footbed with deep heel cup for support EVA midsole absorbs shock, reducing stress on feet, ankles and knees Built-in orthotic is shown to be effective in helping to treat heel pain (plantar fasciitis). Durable Rubber outsole. Heel Height of 1.25 inches
feature_bullets: Dual layer leather or suede uppers in a thong style
Proven to effectively alleviate heel pain.*
Thong sandal style for an easy on and off
Podiatrist designed, biomechanical orthotic footbed with deep heel cup for support
